info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 3:51AM PST until January 17 at 8:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...A wintry mix of precipitation is expected with a mix of rain and snow along with periods of freezing rain or sleet. Total snow accumulations of up to 8-13 inches with up to 17 inches at higher elevations. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...The wintry mix today is expected in areas from the Cascade crest eastward, including Highway 140 east of Lake of the Woods, Highway 62 from Crater Lake eastward, and Highway 138 north of Crater Lake. Moderate snow is expected later tonight through Wednesday evening for areas around Willamette Pass, Diamond Lake, Crater Lake, and Lake of the Woods. Snow is expected across portions of highways 140, 62, and 138. * WHEN...From noon today to 8 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
